doc.previous: In the 18th century, Newcastle was the country's fourth largest print centre after London, Oxford and Cambridge,[28] and the Literary and Philosophical Society of 1793,[28] with its erudite debates and large stock of books in several languages, predated the London Library by half a century.[28] Newcastle also became a glass producer with a reputation for brilliant flint glass.[29]
doc.after: A permanent military presence was established in the city with the completion of Fenham Barracks in 1806.[30]
